skillTree.localised_description: It is not just Vampires that can tame a fierce, barded Undead steed - some Necromancers have such power too.

effects.description: Mount: Barded Nightmare

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Necromancers may summon a Hellsteed, a winged Nightmare, to take them wherever they wish.

effects.description: Mount: Hellsteed

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: The great Ice Drake felled by Greasus Goldtooth that earned him the title 'Drakecrush', Yuwei encountered Jaugrels frozen corpse during his travels. Now he rides him to war.

effects.description: Mount: Jaugrel, the Nights Chill

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

items.colour_text: Hidden within the Celestial Dragon King's court lies a forbidden tome, sealed for centuries within it's most protected of vaults. Rumored to contain the darkest secrets of necromancy, the ancient texts speak of it's ability to reveal the location of a powerful artifact, capable of enhancing the dark rites, and granting its wielder the power to control the undead.

items.colour_text: Deep within the catacombs of a ruin monestary, an artifact of great power lay hidden away.
